title: Railway Car

verbs: To reverse, as the order of the letters h and t in hte, in correcting the spelling of the; or reversing two wires in a circuit.
To reverse or change the order of (two or more things); to swap or interchange.
To change the order of something.
Change the order or arrangement of
nouns: An electric streetcar or tram with a trolley pole for collecting electric current.
A tram, is a rail vehicle which runs on tracks along public urban streets, and also sometimes on separate rights of way.
A passenger vehicle for public use that runs on tracks in the road.
A wheeled vehicle that runs on rails and is propelled by electricity
A railborne vehicle running primarily on streets.
Trolley car or electric tram (streetcar), sometimes confused with a Cable car
Passenger rail vehicle
A tram or light rail vehicle, usually a single car, but also attached together, operating on city streets. A trolley car.
A rail vehicle for carrying loads in a mine; a tram.
Electric bus
A bus, powered via overhead electric cables, that does not run on tracks.
A bus, powered via overhead electric cables, that does not run on tracks
A passenger bus with an electric motor that draws power from overhead wires
A trolleybus is an electric bus that draws its electricity from overhead wires (generally suspended from roadside posts) using spring-loaded trolley poles.
An electric bus
A facility consisting of the means and equipment necessary for the movement of passengers or goods
A means of conveyance.
Shared passenger transport service which is available for use by the general public
The act or the means of conveying people in mass as opposed to conveyance in private vehicles.
Any form of transport that can be used by a member of public (usually for a fee); as opposed to private ownership of e.g. cars.

Public transport is a shared passenger transport service which is available for use by the general public, as distinct from modes such as taxicab, carpooling or hired buses which are not shared by strangers without private arrangement.
The conveyance of people or goods from one place to another, especially on a public transportation system; the vehicles used for such conveyance.
The conveyance of people or goods from one place to another.
One or more self-propelled vehicles that move along fixed rails to transport passengers or cargo
A self-propelled, connected group of vehicles moving on rails.
Line of connected cars or carriages.
A train that is equiped to transport people.
A line of connected railway cars or carriages considered overall as a mode of transport; (as uncountable noun) rail travel.
Public transport provided by a line of railway cars coupled together and drawn by a locomotive

A train is a form of rail transport consisting of a series of vehicles that usually runs along a rail track to transport cargo or passengers although magnetic levitation trains that float above the track exist too.
A system of cables, slung from towers, from which carriers are suspended to transport materials.
Tramways are lightly laid railways, sometimes worked without locomotives.
Type of aerial lift in which the cars are permanently fixed to the cables
An aerial tramway, cable car, ropeway or aerial tram is a type of aerial lift which uses one or two stationary ropes for support while a third moving rope provides propulsion.
A conveyance that transports passengers or freight in carriers suspended from cables and supported by a series of towers
A lightly laid railway for uses such as logging or mining right in the...
A ropeway is a form of naval lifting device used to transport light stores and equipment across rivers or ravines.
A cabin for transportation suspended on cables.
A type of self-propelled passenger-carrying railway vehicle.
Any railway carriage or wagon, a railroad car.
A railcar, in British English and Australian English, is a self-propelled railway vehicle designed to transport passengers.
Any railroad vehicle that is not a locomotive.

The assembly that holds the platen of a typewriter or a typewriterlike printer. On a standard typewriter, the platen and carriage move past a fixed position within the typewriter housing, where the keys strike the paper; the platen rotates to advance the paper held in the carriage. On most impact printers for computers, however, the print head moves back and forth across a platen, which rotates but does not move horizontally; in such machines, the assembly that carries the print head is often called the print-head carriage assembly.
A railway vehicle that is drawn by a locomotive.
A railroad car or railcar, railway wagon or railway carriage, is a vehicle used for the carrying of cargo or passengers on a rail transport system.
Pulled by a locomotive;
A wheeled vehicle adapted to the rails of railroad
Vehicle used for carrying cargo or passengers on rail transport system
Rail transport is a means of conveyance of passengers and goods by way of wheeled vehicles running on rail tracks. transport
A permanent track composed of a line of parallel metal rails fixed to sleepers, for transport of passengers and goods in trains.
Rail transport is a means of conveyance of passengers and goods, by way of wheeled vehicles running on rails.
Line that is the commercial organization responsible for operating a system of transportation for trains that pull passengers or freight
A permanent road consisting of fixed metal rails to drive trains or similar motorized vehicles on.
Conveyance of passengers and goods by way of wheeled vehicles running on rail tracks
A means of conveyance of passengers and goods, by way of wheeled vehicles running on rails
A transport system using these rails used to move passengers or goods.
Transportation of goods and persons by railway.
The transport of passengers and goods by means of wheeled vehicles specially designed to run along railways or railroads.

description:
A railway (railroad) car (carriage) that is generally pulled along a railway line by a locomotive. Shown with a pantograph above the carriage on many platforms which makes it look more like a tram car.

Google’s artwork previously looked like a bus and Microsoft's older versions appeared similar to a minecart.
apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the railway car emoji presents a classic, sleek passenger train car with smooth, rounded edges and a vibrant, glossy finish.  Its design features realistic lighting that casts subtle shadows, emphasizing its 3D form and suggesting forward motion.  This emoji is perfect for conveying journeys, travel plans, or a sense of moving forward, embodying the dependable and modern aesthetic characteristic of Apple's visual style.
